intro: Omalocline pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf omalocline, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Omalocleaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
